questions.question: What is two-factor authentication (2FA)?
answers: Using two passwords for each account.
Using a password and another form of verification to access an account.
Using the same password for two different accounts.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a strong password?
What is the purpose of a password manager?
answers: To keep track of your passwords securely.
To automatically log you into websites.

questions.question: How often should you change your passwords?
answers: Only when you remember to do so.
Every time you log into a site.
At regular intervals and after a security breach.
Never, if it's a strong password.

questions.question: What should you do if your password is leaked in a data breach?
answers: Ignore it if the password is strong.
Use the same password but add a number to it.
